newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Milling wheat futures rise in sleepy Budapest mkt.
newsitem.headline: Milling wheat futures rise in sleepy Budapest mkt.

text.p: Milling wheat futures prices rose on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) on high demand but overall grains turnover remained unimpressive, traders said on Tuesday.
"The nearest maturities rose as there were no sellers on the market," said Robert Vajo of Termin.
May milling wheat rose by the daily allowed 400 forints per tonne to end at 25,230 but only one contract changed hands.
Other milling wheat maturities rose by between 60 forints for August and 390 for July, with only the September maturity remaining unchanged at 22,800 forints.
In contrast, maize futures had a balanced trade with only May and July advancing by 80 and 250 forints.
"Neither domestic nor international trends would have justified serious maize price movements," Vajo said.
May maize, which still has a large number of open contracts, accounted for almost half of Tuesday's total grains turnover in volume terms with 324 contracts.
Total grains turnover was a below-average 705 contracts or 285.9 million forints, of which maize accounted for 394 contracts and milling wheat for 311.
Prices closed unchanged for feed wheat, feed barley and sunflower as none were traded.
